plugins.name: Modify — Figma to website (beta)
plugins.description:
Modify is a website builder inside figma.

Create designs of any complexity and export them immediately to ready-made sites. 


Attention: This plugin is at the beta version and not all functions can work correctly.

We're sorry, we're working on it. Stay tuned!


How it works:


— Install the plugin

— Select frame

— Set up interaction

— Export to the website

— Manage it with a file in figma.


No code, nothing but figma and our plugin to make websites.


Roadmap:


autumn 2022

— Export to the site

— Hover effects

— Domain Connection

— SEO settings

— Basic animation

— Adding videos


winter 2022-2023

— Mobile version 

— Send forms

plugins.name: Print Variables
plugins.description:
NEW UI AVAILABLE✨

📁 Collection UI: Now you can easily select your collections.

📁 Separated Print Functionality: Print with more flexibility!


----

Print Variables

This plugin helps you manage and display variables with style! 🎨


Scope-Based Display: Variables look different depending on their scope.

Supports All Scopes: Whether it's global or specific, we've got you covered.

Multiple Scopes? No problem!: If a variable has more than 2 scopes, it'll show up as a general value.

Auto Grouping by "/" or "-": Automatically group variables with slashes or dashes for better organization!


---

plugins.name: Figma To Roblox
plugins.description:
Export your Figma designs to Roblox, more information on how to use can be found on github,

Suggestions and bug reports can be made on discord.


Simple usage:

  1. Select the item(s) you wish to export
  2. Click 'Convert Selection'
  3. Save the rbxmx file, and import (or drag) into roblox!


Simple usage (video)


Usage with Images:

  1. Run Figma to Roblox
  2. Navigate to your Credentials
  3. (Step 1) Create a new Api Key (via the 'CREATE API KEY' button)
  4. (Step 2) Give the api key 'Assets API' permission
  5. (Step 3) It is recommended to enter your IP, optionally while it isn't recommended you can also add `0.0.0.0/0` to the list to allow any and all IPs to use your key.
  6. Now that you've got an api key, copy and paste it into the 'Cloud API Key' field in the FTR ui (Remember to enter your User/Group ID into the 'User ID' field, and tick 'Upload To Group' if uploading to a group!)
  7. Enable 'Upload Images' (Optionally you can enable 'Export Images' which will export all images and zip them)
  8. Finally, select Convert Selection and wait until you either see a prompt to download or an error pops up
  9. Go into roblox, drag and drop your file, or select Import -> Import from File and select your export!


Example usage (video)


Feel free to suggest updates or report bugs to me:

NoTwistedHere on Discord

Discord server

Github repo
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma Designs to Roblox Instances

plugins.name: eezin
plugins.description:
Preview, compare, use and learn about standard easing functions for your custom prototype easings.


How to use

  1. Open eezin.
  2. Explore a list of standard easing functions for Ease In, Ease Out and Ease In & Out.
  3. Preview any function by clicking on the Preview column for each of the functions.
  4. Add another function to compare if you're having doubts.
  5. Click the function name to copy de cubic bezier value.
  6. Paste into your custom easing in the Interaction Details of your prototype interaction.
  7. Create smooth, beautiful prototypes.

accepted.name: Santiago Moreno
accepted.description: In love with Code, Motion and Typography. I really, really enjoy building stuff and prototyping 🇨🇴

plugins.name: Linearity Move - Animation for your Figma designs
plugins.description:
✨ Turn Your Figma Designs into Stunning Animations – Fast!

Bring your static Figma assets to life with Linearity Move. Whether you’re working on social media content, brand visuals, or advertising assets, our plugin makes animation effortless. No prior animation experience needed!


🚀 How It Works:

1️⃣ Download Linearity Move and create a free Linearity account.

2️⃣ In Figma, open the Linearity Move plugin.

3️⃣ Select the frames or layers you want to animate.

4️⃣ Export and paste them into Move—or send them directly with “Open in Move”.


🎬 Animate in Just a Few Clicks

Animation Presets: Add dynamic motion to any object with a single tap.

Canvas Animation: Drag, move, and tweak elements—Move generates keyframes for you.

Morphing: Transform one shape into another with a press of the “M” key.

Text Animations: Animate headlines, callouts, and captions with fades, slides, typewriter effects, and more.

Video & Audio Support: Import media to make your animations even more engaging.

Pinning & Timing Control: Set precise start and end points to fine-tune animations.


✨ Why Designers Love Linearity Move

✔ No learning curve – perfect if you have no previous animation experience.

✔ Quick & easy exports – share your animations as MP4, GIF, or MOV in up to 8K resolution.

✔ Effortless motion design – make your brand visuals, ads, and social media content stand out.


🔥 Ready to Animate?

Download Linearity Move to get started. The plugin helps you transfer your Figma designs—animation happens in Move!


📌 Note: This plugin requires Linearity Move v1.29+ or Linearity Curve v5.29+.


💡 Need help? Contact us at support@linearity.io.

accepted.name: Linearity
accepted.description:
Ideate. Design. Animate. Turn your Figma designs into powerful animated marketing assets with Linearity Move and Curve 🧡

For support: support@linearity.io

plugins.tagline: Animate and add motion to your Figma projects with Linearity Move

plugins.name: Multi Renamer
plugins.description:
Easy rename multi(choose or all) "INSTANCE names" or "COMPONENT names" or "FRAME names" at one time.


How to Use.


1. CHOOSE "Type" (ALL INSTANCES or ALL COMPONENTS or ALL FRAMES) or Click Objetcs.

2. CLICK "Get List"

3. EDIT names (NOT REMOVE UID)

4. CLICK "Rename"


--------------


一度に複数のインスタンスやコンポーネント、フレームの名前を変更したい時、規則性がなくて「置換しづらい」ことないですか？

このプラグインは全ての「インスタンス」や「コンポーネント」や「フレーム」の名前をリスト化し、リスト名を変更することで一度に大量の置換を行う事ができます。

もちろん、置換したいものだけのリストにすれば、そのリストだけが置換されます。


過去に作られた命名規則のないインスタンス名を一度に変更する際など是非使ってみてください。


使い方

  1. ALL INSTANCES / ALL COMPONENTS / ALL FRAMESのどれかを選択してください。(名前を変更したいオブジェクトを複数選択のみでもOK）
  2. 「Get List」をClickするとIDと名前のタブ区切りテキスト(TSV)のリストが表示されます。
  3. テキストエディタやエクセルに貼り付けて対象の名前を変更します。（この時左側にあるIDはFigmaで使っているIDなので変更しないでください）
  4. 名前を編集し終わったTSVをテキストエリアに上書きして「Rename」ボタンをクリック


※リストで置換しないものはリストから削除しても大丈夫です。

plugins.name: Layer Styles
plugins.description:
Save and apply style presets, including strokes, fills, corner radius, effects, padding, layout grids, layer opacity and blend modes.


This plugin does not store layout direction. This is to support scenarios where people want to apply a layer style to something that already has a layout. I may support this in the future, but at the moment I don't have to time to implement the feature.


Create a layer style


  1. Run Plugins > Layer Styles > Show Layer Styles
  2. Select a frame or shape with styles already applied
  3. Click the + in the bottom right of the plugin window


Apply a layer style


  1. Select the layers you would like to apply the layer style to
  2. Click on the layer style in the list to apply that style


Refresh layer styles


After you make a change to a layer style, you can update any layers which were previously applied with this layer style.


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Right-click on the layer style
  3. Click Refresh


Detaching layer styles from layers


If you no longer want a layer to be associated with a layer style you can detach it.


  1. Select the layer you want to detach the layer style from
  2. In the Properties Panel under Plugin, click "Detach Layer Style".


NOTE: Be careful not to click the minus button as this will remove the plugin command instead. If this happens by mistake, you can re-apply the style and the option to detach the layer style will appear again.


Known issues


  1. There is a bug when creating styles than use variables for the corner radius where the variable is detached

accepted.name: Gavin McFarland
accepted.description: Freelance Designer and Developer who loves making things

plugins.tagline: Save and apply style combinations, such as fills, corner radius, and more

plugins.name: Open Illustrations
plugins.description:
Insert all 1000+ illustrations directly in your Figma files as SVG/Vector.


it's exclusively made up of color illustrations. It's been open sourced with the license: Creative Commons Zero v1.0 Universal (CC0). All illustrations can be used for personal & commercial purposes.


About the license:

The CC0 license is one of the most flexible open source licenses. It allows you to do whatever you'd like with these illustrations.


Plugin features:

  1. Drag and drop any illustrations
  2. Search through them all instantly
  3. Click any illustration to add it your design


This collection was curated by The World-class Designer School.

plugins.name: Abracadabra!
plugins.description:
You no longer have to write lorem-ipsum-text manually and insert images into layouts — Abracadabra will do it for you.


Name the text layers according to their purpose. For example, call the layer for the phone number $Phone Number, and the layer for the name $Name, and so on. 


You can also name the layer $Photo to insert a random image.


That's it! — The plugin will insert text and images into these layers.

plugins.name: Arabs - Names, Phone, and Addresses
plugins.description:
"Arabs" is a Figma plugin that replaces plain text with fictitious, but accurate, Arabic user data, including names, phone numbers, and addresses. All this info may be customized to fit the interface layout and the type of data displayed. The plugin supports both English and Arabic texts.


The plugin can generate the following characteristics:

  • Country (Egypt, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates)
  • Names
  • Phone numbers
  • Addresses


With the following attributes customization:

→ Names

  • Male or female
  • Dual (First and last) or Triple (First, middle, and last)

→ Phone numbers

  • Country codes

→ Addresses

  • City
  • Neighborhood
  • Street
  • Landmark


How to use the plugin:

Just select any text in Figma and run the plugin. Choose the country from which you want to add user info, select the characteristic you want to insert, customize the attributes and press the Replace button.


You can use the plugin in the following cases, and more:

  • Replace sterile "user name" and "user address" with genuine data.
  • Create personas for your user experience research.
  • Add names, addresses, or numbers in control panels or dashboards’ tables and lists.
  • Addresses can be produced with one or more details such as city, street, and landmark.
  • Fill in user profile details with life-like data.
  • Empower Arabic interface design content.
plugins.tagline: Replace text with fictitious, but accurate, Arabic user data; names, phone numbers, and addresses.

plugins.name: SF Symbols Optimizer
plugins.description:
This plugin exports icons created in Figma in SVG format and adds them to custom symbols in SF Symbols It is compatible with SF Symbols 5 and SF Symbols 6.


  1. Open a page in Figma with icons you want to make into SF Symbols; icons created as Frames or Components will be exported.
  2. Select multiple Frames or Components to be exported and click the "Scan" button in the plug-in window. If no frames or components are selected, all frames and components in the page will be registered for export.
  3. Click the "Export" icon to export the SVG file in the SF Symbols 5 format. This SVG files will contain only the following variations size=Small, weight=UltraLight, Regular, Black
  4. Add this SVG file to Xcode as an asset and use it as a custom symbol. Through the SF Symbols mechanism, symbols are available for all Weights and Scales.


* Icons should be sized 1:1 aspect ratio, with no fill color applied to the background.

accepted.name: Shingo Suzuki
accepted.description:
Lead Designer / Interaction Designer
TSUMIKI INC.

plugins.tagline: Optimize Icon to SVG file for import into SF Symbols 6 and SF Symbols 5.

plugins.name: imgcook
plugins.description:
English | 简体中文


imgcook for Figma


A intelligent tool that converts design to code.


imgcook is an ingenious chef who specializes in cooking with various images (Sketch / PSD / static images). it will intelligently generate front-end codes, including view codes, data-binding codes, component codes as well as part of business logic codes from different kinds of design documents.


Our Website: https://www.imgcook.com



How to use the imgcook plugin?


1. Make sure you are logged into your imgcook account.

2. In Figma, go to Plugins and pick imgcook. You should see a new export window.

3. Select any number of frames and hit Export. imgcook will open the "Export successfully, copied to clipboard!" prompt pop-up layer, and then click Go to Paste to restore.


Other functions

  • merge: Merge all the layers in the folder into one picture.
  • group: Circle some layers under a dom node.


4. imgcook will open the editor in a new browser tab. Paste and restore in the editor ctr+v and save as a module, and that’s it.



Community support


For general help using imgcook, please refer to the documentation. For additional help, you can use one of these channels to ask a question:


- GitHub (Bug reports)

- Medium (Get blogs and articles)

- 知乎专栏 (Get blogs and articles in Simplified Chinese)

Create and share your own Figma component libraries

Libriwi is a plugin for Figma that lets you easily created and share Figma groups, layouts and components with a single click of the button. Easily share your designs with yourself, your team, clients or the world.


✅ Upload any component, group or layer

Organize all of your design elements in one place so you don't have to spend hours looking through hundreds of files in your Figma library.

Create your own private or public library of components, groups and layers from scratch or import existing ones to build on top of them.

plugins.name: Crowdin for Figma
plugins.description:
Localize UI and translate marketing visuals efficiently with Crowdin plugin for Figma.


Crowdin is a cloud-based localization management platform that speeds up and automates localization. Trusted by GitHub, Pipedrive, GitLab, Buffer, and Magento, it helps companies of any size localize their apps, websites, games, marketing content, and more.


Use Cases


Crowdin plugin for Figma will be of use if you:

 

  1. Create multilingual user interfaces and want to provide clear experiences across markets. Learn more.
  2. Collaborate with other teams on mobile applications or software localization.
  3. Need to quickly translate static visuals like social media graphics, posters, blog visuals, and more. Learn more.


Synchronize Localizable Content Across Tools

 

Crowdin integration with Figma works both ways. You can send designs for translation and upload them back to Figma for further customization. 

 

When localizing UI, you can synchronize content between Figma, Crowdin, and your repository on GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and Azure Repos. Your engineering team can use Crowdin API and CLI to set up instant content synchronization.


Prototype with the Real Copy and Test Translated Versions


Once the production-ready texts are uploaded to Crowdin, you can stop using Lorem Ipsum in your mockups. 


Get the list of source strings, use the real copy in your mockups, edit texts if necessary, and send new strings for translation with the keys and screenshots for translators. 


Upload translated mockups back to Figma and customize them before the development starts.


Learn more.


Set up Continuous Workflow for App Localization


App localization can now start at the prototyping step:


  1. Designers send texts for translation to Crowdin with the keys, tags, and screenshots.
  2. Translation teams work on the texts in Crowdin.
  3. The translated variants are tested and customized back in Figma.
  4. Development teams then download source and translate files from Crowdin and integrate them into the codebase.
  5. Works in Figma Dev mode, allowing developers to quickly inspect the text layer and get all information about the string, including its file or key.


Use Different Translation Approaches


In Crowdin, texts can be pre-translated via AI or Machine Translation engines (Google Translator, DeepL, Microsoft Translator, and others). You can also invite your in-house translators, freelancers, or an agency. Crowdin will create Translation Memory automatically, so you will be able to reuse translations and pre-translate texts using your TM in the future.


Human translators will have sufficient context while translating your content. When working on UI localization, you can automatically upload screenshots to the localization project.


When translating static pages, like posters and banners, translators will preview full frames in Crowdin and see the visual context for every text.


How to Set Up


To get started, you will need a Crowdin account and a localization project under it. You can create a new project, or ask for manager access to the existing one.

Sign up for a Crowdin account.


If you manage a project in Crowdin yourself after a 14-day free trial, select one of the subscription plans.


To connect Figma and Crowdin accounts:


1. Install Crowdin for Figma Plugin.

2. Open the necessary Figma file.

3. Head to the menu in the top-left corner and select Plugins > Crowdin.

4. Provide Personal Access Token. You can generate it in your Account Settings in Crowdin.

5. If you’re connecting your Crowdin Enterprise account, specify your Organization name.


See a detailed guide on how to use the Crowdin translation plugin for Figma.


Contact us 24/7 if you need any assistance.

accepted.description: Crowdin is a cloud-based solution that streamlines the localization of the product's user interface, website, marketing, and support content.

plugins.name: Color Theme Manager
plugins.description:
About

Color Theme Manager is a light weight easy to use plugin for create and swap between different color themes. Simply save color styles as you normally do and Color Theme Manager can help you with the rest. No need to worry about JSON, naming prefix, selection, etc. Good for developing color systems, projects require multiple color themes (like dark mode and light mode), and giving your design a new look.

Features

Save Color Theme
Carefully name your current color theme and it will be saved within the Figma file you are working with. This will save all local color styles into a color theme. Note color styles in color themes will not update when you modified local color styles, you need to manually save changes to color themes.

Apply Color Theme
Change to an entirely different look by applying a color theme with only one click. Your local color styles will be replaced by ones from the color theme you choose.

 Import/Export Color Themes
Due to the current Figma Plugin API limitation, transferring data across Figma file can not be streamlined. A second-best solution is offered by Color Theme Manager, simply copy your saved color theme into clipboard and paste to another file.

How?

Color Theme Manager will look for color style from a saved theme with the exact same name and replace the local style. So name your color styles (and color themes) wisely. Repeated names will cause unexpected results.

Future

- Features like auto update, read/write to libraries can not be implemented efficiently with the current set of APIs. This might change when new APIs come out.
- Color styles involve image fill is not implemented very efficiently. This might be fixed in a future update.
- UI might be reimplemented in a more maintainable way.

plugins.name: Colors → Code
plugins.description:
Export your color tokens directly into any given format to smoothly integrate them into your stack.

----------------------------------------
Direct export options 
(Export 50 colors for free - no subscription required)
• CSS (.css)
• Less (.less)
• SCSS (.scss)
• SASS (.scss)
• Stylus (.styl)
• PostCSS (.css)
• CSS Crush (.css)
• React (.js)
• ReactNative (.js)
• Android (.xml)
• iOS (.swift)
----------------------------------------
How to use the plugin
• Select elements, choose an export option and click export. 
----------------------------------------
How the plugin works
• Color: Fill value of the selected element
• Name: Name of the selected element
• Case Style: The correct casing automatically applies for each framework through special characters. (e.g. "Primary Color" becomes "primaryColor")
----------------------------------------
Good to know
• Choose your file naming-convention wisely as these names carry over to your codebase.
----------------------------------------
About icanicon.io
• icanicon.io is a Design System Middleware that allows you to manage, import, convert and sync UI tokens and components directly from the most popular Design Tools into your application code. Check it out here:
https://icanicon.io/

Thanks, and enjoy it!
Your Sugarcode Team.

plugins.name: Advanced Variable Export [AVE]
plugins.description:
This plugin will help you to handle all your variables and styles for the development team!



🤘Key features:

⚡ Variables export to code variables

⚡ Styles (text, effects, colors) export to classes

⚡ Variables fragmentation to folders depending on the variables hierarchy in the project

⚡ HEXA or RGBA color export

⚡ CSS or SCSS color export

⚡ Complete export of each collection or separate export for single ones

⚡ Devmode sidebar integration



✍ More about:

From now on developers can export all basic variables to CSS or even SCSS just in few clicks, bypassing routine of analysing each asset properties or huge variables table.


And even more! If your project has lots of variables with complex hierarchy - it is possible to export variables with fragmentation. If your variables structure looks like different levels and folders - why don't you have your variables stored in real folders - making it simple to maintain them throught the project development? No more obstacles - fragmentation feature is right here as well!


Plugin also allows you to switch between HEX and RGBA formats for colors and export all your text styles into the classess!


🙌 Feedback & support

We would appreciate any of your bug reports and functionality suggestions!


You can contact us via email:

📧 info@code-creators.tech

📧 kitponomarenko@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Easily export your variables collections to CSS or SCSS with hierarchy fragmentation feature!

plugins.name: Design To Code
plugins.description:
Introduction：

Select the area in figma and convert the figma design draft into html and css code

Export：

  1. inline CSS styles and separately exported styles
  2. jsx html and normal html

This project aims to explore the possibility of converting Figma design drafts into front-end code. Currently, the generation of flex layouts is still under exploration, and discussions and suggestions are welcome.

A version that generates flex layouts to enhance maintainability is expected to be released in Version 2. Stay tuned.


简介：

在Figma中选择区域，点击按钮可将Figma设计稿转换为HTML和CSS代码

导出内容：

  1. 内联CSS和单独的css样式
  2. jsx html以及普通html代码

本项目旨在探索figma设计稿转换前端代码的可能性，现在关于生成弹性布局的内容仍在探索中，欢迎讨论和建议。

生成弹性布局，增强可维护性的版本，预计将在V2版本发布，敬请期待。


by：高途-用户前端组

plugins.name: WordCloud.app
plugins.description:
Create visual art with this Word Cloud generator plugin!

Add words of your own or use one of our thematic presets. Automatically generate a pleasing color palette. And enjoy your words filling the frame!


How to use

  1. Create a frame.
  2. Pick a preset or add your own words.
  3. Rearrange words as needed. Closer to the beginning = closer to the center.
  4. Add one or several text colors. Colors will be applied to words randomly to create a pleasing picture.
  5. Don't like the arrangement? Click the "refresh" button, it will rearrange words in a new manner.
  6. Select several fonts for a beautiful effect and pick a shape to reflect your theme.
  7. Enjoy!


Have feedback?

Help me understand what features to add next! Report bugs or make suggestions! Please leave feedback here.


Thanks!

— Elena @ WordCloud.app

FigDuo is an essential Figma plugin that offers instant access to a vast library of UI components. With over 150,000 components and sets, 140,000 icons, and more than 560 UI kits, FigDuo allows you to effortlessly search, explore, and insert elements directly into your designs—no need to save or publish UI kits within your team.

plugins.name: Pathway
plugins.description:
Pathway is a tool for rapid usability testing: it helps to get actionable insights on your product before the development stage.


Create a test, import your Figma prototype, send a link to your testers and get test results with 📈 comprehensive analytics and ⏯️ video recordings in a matter of minutes.


This plugin helps to import your prototype to Pathway.


Please, note: currently there are some limitations for prototypes (not all of the Figma prototyping possibilities are supported — but we are working on it).


How it works:


  1. Create a test on Pathway (pthwy.design)
  2. Add a Figma block
  3. Import prototype using the plugin and paste your unique prototype code inside the Figma block.


Help: https://help.pthwy.design/articles/how-to-prepare-your-figma-prototype
plugins.tagline: Test your prototype flows with real users

plugins.name: Vivid | Free React, Tailwind, TS, CSS Modules from Figma
plugins.description:
Vivid cuts out redundant development work by letting designers own your UI while developers focus on functionality.


Designers submit their Figma designs through the Vivid plugin to automatically generate and maintain a UI library in their team’s codebase. With every new design submitted, Vivid will generate any new components necessary and create a pull request directly in GitHub.


Features

  • Code Generation. Vivid generates React code using TypeScript and CSS modules from your Figma designs.
  • Sandbox Preview. Preview the code Vivid generates in a shareable sandbox.
  • Existing Component Support. Automatically link your implemented components from your codebase to the components available in your Figma asset library.
  • GitHub Integration. Create a pull request for developers to review with the newly generated code.


Roadmap

  • Responsiveness. Vivid will soon allow you to specify different screen sizes for larger designs so that the code you generate will automatically be responsive!
  • Modularity. To prevent unnecessarily long code files, Vivid will automatically break its generated code into more manageable components and files
  • CSS Frameworks. Tailwind and styled components support is coming soon!


Support

Reach out to aryaman@vivid.lol with any feedback, bugs, or support needs!


Join our Slack channel for product updates, to provide feedback, or just to chat!
plugins.tagline: Hand off ready-to-use components from Figma

plugins.name: Sitemap Gecko
plugins.description:
Spend less time sitemapping and more time creating meaningful designs

Sitemap Gecko is a time-saving sitemapping tool made for busy UX agencies and designers.


Use Cases

Create ready-to-present sitemaps in minutes

Use the sitemap builder to create polished, presentation-ready sitemaps.


Evaluate web structures in seconds

Visualise the site structure of your client (or competitor😉) - just enter their website URL.



To get started, try recreating your latest client's site structure using the sitemap builder.



Features

Create visual sitemaps

Use the sitemap builder to create visual sitemaps from scratch.


Visualise site structures from URL

Simply enter a website's URL to visualise its page structure.


Collaborate with your team

Sitemaps/site structures are exported to the Figma canvas where your team can make changes & add comments.


Save sitemaps

Sitemaps made in the builder can be saved & edited later.


Export sitemaps- as images

Once put on the Figma canvas, you can easily export the sitemaps as PNG/JPG/SVG.


Export sitemaps- as XML

Any sitemap created in the builder can also be exported as a XML sitemap. Especially useful if your organisation does SEO.


Get started for free

Sitemap Gecko comes with a free plan, which includes limited usage of the sitemap builder, as well as 2 site structure imports.


Upgrading grants you unlimited sitemap builder usage, sitemap XML exports and 100 sitemap imports. A license costs $23.



Questions & Support

If you have any questions or would like to provide feedback, please contact me at joseph@sitemapgecko.com or leave a comment.

accepted.name: Joseph
accepted.description: Reach out to me on joseph@sitemapgecko.com !

plugins.tagline: Less time sitemapping, more time designing.

plugins.name: Team Library Component Browser
plugins.description:
List, browse, and create instance your team library (and local) components.


🔥 What you can:


- List and browse your team library components.

- Create instance of conponent from this plugin.

- Swap the instance and selection(s).

- Keep the size and layout of selection when you swap.


👉 How to use Team Library Component Browser:


1. Open this plugin in library what you want to list.

2. Go to Setting tab in this plugin.

3. Click ‘Save or update this library data’ button to save all components data in library to this plugin.

4. Go back to your document and open this plugin.

5. Find components by searching or scrolling, then double-click or click "Create" button to insert instance into document.

6. Enjoy🏖


🖌 Notes:


Because of the specifications of Figma's API, we can't get team library data automatically.

So this plugin uses the figma.clientStorage API to store the library data on your machine.

To store library data in clientStorage, you need to run this plugin in your library.


📮 Support:


If you have any plobrem or feedback, please use the GitHub Issues.

https://github.com/ryonakae/figma-plugin-team-library-component-browser/issues


---


This plugin is made by Ryo Nakae 🙎‍♂️.

https://brdr.jp

https://twitter.com/ryo_dg

https://github.com/ryonakae

plugins.name: Shader
plugins.description:
Generate shades and tints of any color in 2 easy steps.


Create up to 255 shades of your selected base color/s. That's right. Create shades of multiple selected colors all in 1 go!


No need to mess with hard to use UI's. Generate shades using just 2 commands.


Required:

  • An element (Shape), with 1 Solid fill.


How to Use:

  1. Select any number of elements with 'Solid' Fill.
  2. Go to Plugins > Shader OR Click Ctrl + / (For Windows) or ⌃ + / (For Mac)
  3. Select 'Lighten' or 'Darken' from the dropdown.
  4. Finally, enter the number of shades you want to generate and press Enter


Notes:

It will only generate shades and tints for elements that have a solid fill as their first fill. It will not work for gradients, images or elements with no fill. NO Shades will be created for such elements.


Suggestions to improve the plugin are much appreciated. Enjoy! 😊

accepted.name: Karmit Patel
accepted.description: Frontend Developer.

plugins.tagline: Shader: Perfectly Harmonized Colors, Every Time

plugins.name: Halftone Effect
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to quickly apply a halftone-style effect to any image inside Figma. Choose from three different dot shapes (circles, squares, crosses) and customize the size and color of the dots to get the perfect effect.


How to Use

  1. Select an image in Figma.
  2. Open the Halftone Effect Plugin from the Plugins menu.
  3. Adjust the dot size, shape, and color using the controls.
  4. Click Generate, and a new image with the halftone effect will be created.


Works best with high-contrast images and does not modify the original image.
plugins.tagline: Apply a halftone effect to your image with customizable dot size, shape, and color.

plugins.name: Rename layer
plugins.description:
This plugin renames elements (that contains inner elements, like groups, frames, instances..) by a specific inner text layer content.


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)


Demo here.

Support my work here <3


Use case example:

You have cards that represents movies. Each card contains an image, movie name, description and a button. You want to name all the cards by the movie name.



How it works?

  1. Run the plugin
  2. You can choose to rename by
  3. A specific layer name
  4. Another character / phrase that you can add to the beginning of the layer name

Make sure all the frames you want to rename are selected.

Important: This plugin saves the last layer name you replaced by.
plugins.tagline: Bulk renaming based on specific contained text layer

plugins.name: Figma Sound Kit Plugin
plugins.description:
Unleash the power of sound in your Figma designs with Sound Kit Plugin. Integrate, edit, and optimize audio and video files directly within Figma, with access to three sound kits and over 1000 sound files.


This tool allows you to add audio and video elements, making your projects more interactive and engaging. Easily integrate sound effects, video content or background audio. This plugin also solves Figma's limitation by converting audio files to video format, enabling seamless upload any audio file to Figma and integration of sound interactions in your prototypes. Plus, access three popular sound kits and over 1000 sound files to enhance your projects.


Features:

  1. Seamless Integration: Add audio and video files directly into Figma projects.
  2. Wide Format Support: Supports MP3, WAV, M4A, OGG, MP4, MOV, WEBM formats.
  3. Automatic Audio Conversion: Converts audio formats to MP4 for Figma compatibility.
  4. Extensive Sound Library: Includes three famous sound kits and over 1000 sound files ready to be added to your projects with a single click. (Material Design Sounds, Facebook Sound Kit, !Boring Sound Kit)
  5. Download Sound Files: Easily download sound files to use in your designs.
  6. Phone System UI audio such as iOS, Android, Samsung and much more...


Use Cases:

  1. Interactive Prototypes: Use of audio cues and elements to improve a user's interaction with digital products.
  2. Enhanced Audio interaction: Add background music or sound effects.
  3. Add Audio to Your Prototype: Embed audio to make your prototypes more immersive, solving Figma's audio limitation.
  4. Marketing Materials: Embed audio and video to capture attention.
  5. Educational Content: Add audio explanations and video demos.
  6. UX Design: Incorporate audio cues and video walkthroughs.


A quick and easy way to show your appreciation for this plugin is by buying me a coffee. This one-time contribution fuels my passion and helps maintain the development of the plugin.


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/lucksy

accepted.name: Amila Sampath
accepted.description: Hi, I'm Amila. I design & build user interfaces.

plugins.tagline: Figma Sound Kit - Upload Audio and Video and Access Over 1000 UI Sound Files

plugins.name: Berrycast: Simple Screen Recorder & Sharing Tool
plugins.description:
Dead simple to use screen recording tool.


Berrycast your colleagues. 

It’s more productive.


The ability to share what’s on your screen within Figma and FigJam collaborations with your colleagues has never before been so easy. With Berrycast, simply hit the record button and add your spoken narrative. Your team will be more productive, and your message will be clearer than ever before. 


Get started now > berrycast.com.


Our mission is to make every second of your life more productive. We believe that starts with clear communications supported by the most appropriate tools.


Berrycast is a lightweight extension and native app combo that helps you share messages on your screen, using your voice and your face (both optional) to support your message. By clearly being able to show and articulate your user experience, viewers can learn and understand what you are trying to convey. 


There’s no longer any need to download an app and then create a video that needs to be uploaded to YouTube. Create and share clear video messages in less time than it would take to type an email. 


It takes 5 easy steps to Berrycast:

  1. Hit record
  2. Strut your stuff (narrate if desired while showing the screen)
  3. Stop the video
  4. Copy the automatically-created URL
  5. Share away! 


How can you use Berrycast to improve productivity? Let us count the ways.


  1. Designs: As you iterate on your app’s design, recruit your teammates to provide feedback on their own time and at their own convenience. Easily highlight specific elements and narrate the feedback, preventing misunderstandings and confusion, and saving yourself from unnecessary and gruelling review meetings.
  2. Onboarding: Easily record hellos and welcomes to new teammates, communicate goals and progress, saving meeting times for real meetings. Using a new team collaboration tool? Teach your colleagues how to use the product with a quick Berrycast that can be watched at their convenience at varying speeds.
  3. Technical support: Got an issue with something? Record the issue, get the URL, and send it to your tech team to evaluate. This is also perfect for customers to communicate what design concerns they may be observing in your product to improve overall user experience.

plugins.name: AI Content Generator / Rewrite
plugins.description:
AI Text Generator is a super handy Figma plug-in made for designers who want to rewrite their text in a couple of clicks. It uses OpenAI GPT-4 to give you smart, creative text suggestions—think names, titles, or even Lorem Ipsum dummy text—right where you need them. It automatically detects the selected text’s length and generates the perfect amount of words for your alternatives. You can also add custom prompts, which is useful for more control, generate any type of text, in different languages and amount of words.


Right now, it's provided for free by DesignCode. That is until the API costs are through the roof!


Cool Features You'll Love:


  • Suggestions: This plugin won’t mess up your design by changing things without asking. You get a list of suggestions and you pick what works best—no surprises.
  • Smart Detection: Whether it's counting words or matching character lengths, the AI does the math for you. This means your text fits perfectly every time, just like you planned.
  • Custom Prompts: Need something specific? Type in a prompt and let the AI whip up something special just for you, whether it’s in a different language or just a particular style.
  • Really fast: This plugin is all about speed. It helps you get the job done quicker and lets you move on to other cool parts of your project.



How Do You Use


  1. Select your text layer: Click on any text in your Figma project that you want to jazz up.
  2. Apply from suggestions: the AI will show you a bunch of different options based on the text you selected. Take a look and see what catches your eye.
  3. Or, add a custom text: Enter a prompt to guide the AI, and it’ll tailor the suggestions for you. We have a cheatsheet to help out.

accepted.name: Meng To
accepted.description: I teach designers code and developers design.

plugins.tagline: Rewrite your text content with AI suggestions for titles, texts, names, locations and languages

plugins.name: Auto Layout via keyboard
plugins.description:
Description

I am just too lazy to click on the small button of Auto Layout to change the value, so I made this plugin.


if you find this helpful, feel free to try it out.


How it work?

  1. Choose a frame first
  2. "Search Auto Layout via Keyboard" with quick action bar
  3. Hit "Tab" to enter plugin
  4. Enter the number by the following guide


The parameter have 3 parts:

First part is to choose either you want the layout to be Vertical or Horizontal.


Second is set the spacing between each item, you enter enter any positive number.


Third is set the padding for this auto layout, it's work just like how you set padding in CSS. like 24,48, this mean the top and bottom padding is 24, and left and right padding is 48.


You need to separate the number by comma.


More example

  • Enter 48, this apply to four side of padding.
  • Enter 24,48, 24 apply to top & bottom, 48 apply to left & right.
  • Enter 24,32,48, 24 apply to top, 32 apply to left & right, 48 apply to bottom
  • Enter 24,32,48,12, 24 apply to top, 32 apply to right, 48 apply to bottom, and 12 apply to left (it's clockwise)
